Title: Contract: Senior Data Engineer
Descripcion: Upwork ($UPWK) is the world’s work marketplace. We serve everyone from one-person startups to over 30% of the Fortune 100 with a powerful, trust-driven platform that enables companies and talent to work together in new ways that unlock their potential. Last year, more than $3.3 billion of work was done through Upwork by skilled professionals who are gaining more control by finding work they are passionate about and innovating their careers. This is an engagement through Upwork’s Hybrid Workforce Solutions (HWS) Team. Our Hybrid Workforce Solutions Team is a global group of professionals that support Upwork’s business. Our HWS team members are located all over the world. If you’re passionate about solving hard problems at big data scale, knowing that your contribution to Upwork is enabling massive economic value and creating social value globally, then please read on. Implements enterprise data management concepts (Data Governance, Data Engineering, Data Science, Data Lake, Data Warehouse, Data Sharing, Data Applications) Build data pipelines and modern ways of automating data pipelines using cloud based testing and clearly document implementations, so others can easily understand the requirements, implementation, and test conditions. Monitor and detect performance issues on Databricks and Spark ETL Pipelines and suggest improvements both on tuning and rewriting. Must Haves (Required Skills): B.S., M.S., or Ph.D. in Computer Science (or a related field) or equivalent work experience Extensive hands-on experience (3+ years) working as a Big Data Engineer or Data Engineer or Developer in large-scale data processing and analytics projects. Strong proficiency in Spark and PySpark for distributed data processing and analytics. Experience designing and implementing large-scale, distributed systems Knowledge of workflow management tools like Airflow for orchestrating ETL pipelines. Familiarity with version control systems like GitHub for managing codebase. Experience with relational models (snowflake) and NoSql models (graph databases, DynamoDB) Experience in multi-threaded software development (or some form of parallelism) Previous experience working on startups and/or innovation teams Experience in working with Cloud providers such as AWS or GCP or Azure.
